reviewText:
Its essentially the same game, but with some graphical tweaks and all the DLC that was released put into one package. If you have the old version of DI:Riptide in your steam libary you can pick this up for $3. If you have played DI:Riptide and feel like you have experienced it to its fullest, there is not really a need to get this as its exactly the same in terms of everything, but graphics. If you feel like playing DI:Riptide again, for this price, why not buy it?

The game runs wonderfully too. On my PC (Look at specs below) I get upwards of 90-100fps in most scenarios and only see dips when there are a lot of zombies or NPCs on screen. I have not run into any bugs yet either, which is a plus.
I have an FOV fix below if you need help with tweaking your FOV.

(SPECS):
CPU: Intel Core i5-3470 3.2ghz
GPU: EVGA GTX 970 4gb OC'd to 1530mhz
STORAGE: WD Blue 1tb

(FOV FIX):
**REQUIRES 7-Zip**
-Go into your DI:Riptide directory. This can be found by right clicking DI:Riptide in Libary, select Properties>Local Files>Browse Local Files.
-Look for the folder DIR then search for Data0.pak. Right click this, hover your mouse over 7-Zip, then click Open Archive."
-This will bring up a window that says "data". Select the data folder then look for a folder called skills. Open it.
-Look for default_levels.xml and right click it. Select Edit.
-Click CTRL+F and in the box that comes up type "fov" without quotes.
-On the line <prop n="CameraDefaultFOV" v="62.5"/> -- replace "62.5" with desired Field of View (FOV).
-Exit and start game. Play."

reviewText:
Product received for free

Dead Island Riptide Definitive Edition is without a doubt the best version of Riptide.

Aside form the visual upgrade, the game feels  responsive, smooth and is no longer plagued with the issues found in the original. Highly recommended.

Riptide adds some defense mechanics where you fight against horde invasions, some new crafting components and a weapon specific leveling systems that adds perks as you use more of specific types of weapons. Otherwise its more of Dead Island.

See the full review and comparison here:  (Review for the Collectors Edition - Not Riptide Specific)

https://youtu.be/zlRgQGxMYJE

EDIT: There some collision bugs I noted down in my other review text that appear here as well.

reviewText: Dead Island Riptide Definitive Edition brings to the table what the original Dead Island Riptide had to it, alongside with a lot of new graphics features and advancements. It runs on the all-new Dying Light engine, Chroma 6, which is a large upgrade from the original Chroma 5 engine, and it brings with it a lot of new post-processing effects, making the island look more beatiful than ever. A lot of the models have been replaced, all of the textures have been completely re-done at a higher resolution, bringing more detail to all the characters. The introduction of the new physically based shading teqhnique and photorealistic lighting system brings new life to the island. It's a great game if you loved the original, or even if you didn't. It's worth the $3 it is currently on steam, and even worth the $20 for people who didn't own the original game!

reviewText:
Played the original version on overclocked acer nitro with gtx860m, I was able to maintain 60fps max settings at 1080p BUT WITH MICROSTUTTER.

This version, I can only play at 900p with max setting in order to maintain 60fps, but I can confirm no microstutter. And even at lower resolution I can vouch for the graphics improvement. It does look better than the original even at lower resolution.

Other than that, I believe the gameplay remain the same.

reviewText:
I have always been a die-hard Dead Island fan, completed all games (Including Dying Light) numerous times, and was one of those fans who saw the massive bugs as a reason to play the game :D. This Remaster came as a massive surprise and didnt hesitate to pick it up immediately, and i have to say, you can tell its a remaster.
This isn't just Techland's way of scamming you for money. For once, you can actually tell that a AAA developer has recognised what people seem to enjoy and have worked around it.
I would definately recommend to anyone , however the experience is SO much more fun if you have a friend or two to play with.

Just one bug i have found though, and that is; With Logan, whenever a Zombie latches onto me and i punch them away or even just kick them, it's like i am the ♥♥♥♥ing Dragonborn from Skyrim or some ♥♥♥♥ cause EVERY zombie just goes flying and their limbs just explode. It was hilarious at first, but it's kinda annoying now. (I havn't tested this with other characters yet, so im not sure if its just for Logan or a bug in general :L)

EDIT---

It was one punch mode, not a bug LOL

reviewText: I suppose this should be obvious, but I'm going to say it anyway: If you didn't like Riptide, you're not going to like this. A very pretty overhaul can't change what you didn't like about the game in the first place. The characters still make idiotic comments. In fact, the humans are the worst part of the game, just like they were in the original. No wonder why the zombies wanted to kill them!\n\nBut, if you liked the game, you'll like this even more. Why? Well, in my case, it was a nice opportunity to play the game again, and having the textures polished really was a nice touch. The zombies are just as awesome, and maybe moreso because of the clarity makes them feel like that much more of a menace. For $3, it's totally worth it.

reviewText:
It is certainly nice with PBR, but it is far from being well optimized, at the contrary of engines like UE4 for example.
On my computer, UT4 runs smoothly as 50 fps with almost all options at max but the antialiasing. (MSI: I7 3610QM, GTX670, RAM 20Go)
With Dead Island: Riptide DE, all is set to minimum and the better I get is 16fps when in a corridor...

The standard edition is definitely the best choice if you have not a rig with a gtx 980 ti...

reviewText:
Yup, I got what I was afraid of. Polite warning: I can't help but compare this to Dying Light, so bear with me (no, we're not going to eat raw salmon, not right now).

It's still pretty clumsy in terms of gameplay. I mean, they haven't even touched the fighting system; compared to DL, it feels stale and very repetitive.

Pretty much all  the characters  featured are forgettable. In DL, every person had a ♥♥♥♥ing personality. Dead Island is full of dull people with horrible voice-acting.

BUTT ( YES, a wild butt appears)!!!

It is still pretty enjoyable. There is something very relaxing about this game, and I think I'm going to give it a chance,

tl;dr - You played  Dead Island games and liked them, but want better graphics? Buy Definitive Edition.
You played DI and found it bad? Forget this game.
You didn'y play DI games but want to give them a whirl? That's the moment, don't be shy.
